page.title: 12Holidays
page.content: We had a look at the holiday that people in our class had during the last twelve months. Five didn't go away for a holiday;five went abroad, mainly Spain. Of the 21 holidays taken in the United kingdom, Dorset and Wales were most popular. The choice of Wales being higher because four scouts camped there. Half the holidays were camping or staying in a caravan and a fifth stayed with friends. Only three stayed at a hotel. Apart from the scouts nearly all the others went on holiday with their family. Most travelled by car, four went by plane, none by train. Two thirds of the holidays were for one week or less. The 1985 scout camp was in Wales. We mostly went canoeing but we also went pony trecking and hiking. We had camp fires where we told jokes and stories.
